header.p: Open Source development is inherently chaotic due the fact that all development is decentralized. Don't get discouraged by that, learn to ask as many questions as possible on the mailing lists.

section.title: Developer Mailing List : openejb-dev@exolab.org
section.p: Where the general OpenEJB community goes to ask questions, make suggestions, chat with other users and developers, and keep a finger on the pulse of the project.
Medium volume (possibly more than 5 messages a day) mailing list, dedicated to the development of OpenEJB.

section.title: CVS Mailing List : openejb-cvs@exolab.org
section.p: A mailing list for the OpenEJB CVS repository!

We have mixed a few of the popular perl scripts for cvs email notification as well as added a few features that are all new. This new list and perl script provide you with as-it-happens information regarding OpenEJB development. You can now get the scoop on the changes that take place in OpenEJB as our team is hard at work in developing and refining the OpenEJB container system.
The emails to the cvs mailing list are generated by the perl script and contain:

Information about the user performing the cvs commit
A list of files being added, changed, and removed
A log message from the user performing the cvs commit
A diff of the changes made to each file committed
At this time we would still like to keep all dialog on the openejb-dev list. Questions regarding content sent to the openejb-cvs list should be sent to the developer list for everyone to benefit from. When quoting email from the openejb-cvs list, please only quote the part of the email that is most relevant to your question.
